page.title: 01STOCKPORT GAZETTEER
page.content:
Population: 291,000 (1981 census) Area: Built up 7,115 hectares Green belt 4,860 hectares Parks 630 hectares
Stockport is a Metropolitan Borough on the South side of Greater Manchester. This D-block covers the NW of the town and includes the town centre.The area is dominated by the Rivers Goyt and Tame which run in a westerly direction from the Pennines and converge to form the River Mersey just to the east of the town centre. Stockport is a good example of a medieval market town transformed by the industrial revolution. Silk,cotton and hatting were once major industries. The town has an excellent shopping centre,a covered market and a street market.
